Item.Header: New paper in Nature Communications
Item.Body: From Marinica group, CEA Saclay. Compact Frank-Kasper nano-phases are previously missed 3D structures which significantly revise our understanding of irradiation damage in materials. Our TAMMBER code was used to rapidly explore the complex energy landscape surrounding these clusters, to establish their stability in realistic scenarios.

Item.Header: New paper in Procedings of Royal Society
Item.Body: With Wales group, U Cambridge. An in depth analysis of "Ill Conditioned" Markov Chains- stochastic discrete state models with transition rates that vary massively from state-to-state- to such a degree that standard analytical treatments fail. We show how these challenging models can be simulated efficiently and stably via a novel state reduction scheme that preserves first passage statistics between communities.

Item.Header: New paper in Acta Materialia
Item.Body: A tour-de-force from postdoc of Petr Grigorev, funded by ANR MeMoPas. We use machine learning potentials as a highly flexible coupling medium, allowing world-first large-scale atomistic simulations of defects and dislocations (i.e. real materials), where the machine learning force field can be replaced by an embedded DFT simulation in any region of interest. The first paper uses this to investigate impurity segregation to dislocations - a small region around the impurity is treated with DFT, whilst the remainder by a state-of-the-art machine learning force-field. Many more exciting results from this project to come, as Petr will now be funded by a new grant from CEA, PTC Emergence. The published paper:

Item.Header: New paper in Computational Materials Science
Item.Body: From PhD of Reza Namakian. Using PAFI, the full stacking fault free energy profile is evaluated at finite temperature for the first time. Only metastable points have previously been evaluated; our full calculation gives the unstable stacking fault (important for fracture) and shows excellent agreement with molecular dynamics of isolated dislocations. Reza is a student under Prof. Dorel Moldovan, Louisiana state university.

Item.Header: Petr's paper on ReproHack
Item.Body: Reproducibility, the ability to reproduce reported results from underlying data, computer code and reported methodology, are essential for modern computational science. ReproHack is a new effort to demonstrate good practice in reproducible research, and Petr's paper is a great example!
